page.title: 05LIMERIGG RELIGION 1
page.content: Limerigg village owes its existance to coal mining. The pits of the area reached their peak in the latter half of the 19th century. The growth in population brought with it the demand for schooling and organised religion. At the beginning of the 1880's Limerigg mission was started through the good offices of Slamannan Parish Church. By 1885 the church building was in being; built from corrugated iron. The first missionary was the Rev.George Waugh,B.D.; and the parish minister was the Rev.Robert Horne. Rev Horne is well remembered for the fact that his son Robert reached high office in the British Government, serving as Chancellor of the Exchequer during the First World War. With the decline in mining the population decreased very rapidly.
